description: From Middle English bridale, from Old English brȳdealo (“wedding ale; wedding feast”); synchronically analyzable as bride +‎ ale. The attributive usage was strengthened by association with bride +‎ -al.

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to a bride, or to wedding; nuptial.
examples: bridal ornaments; a bridal outfit; a bridal chamber

entries.meaning: (archaic) A wedding feast or festival; a wedding.
